results.title: A Matter of survival
results.creator_credit: Bill Brind, ONF | NFB, Canada Department of Labour and Bernard Devlin
results.brief_description: Much has been said about the predicament of the blue-collar worker in the automated world of industry. This film is about a similar threat to the white-collar worker in the business world. It portrays a situation in a company where computer methods are about to be introduced to take over much of the paperwork, consequently “making surplus” a number of responsible, long-time employees. The film poses the problem from the points of view of both management and of the employees concerned. Awards: New York; Antwerp; Knokke

results.title: A Matter of survival
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Tasfilm Productions, National Fitness Council of Tasmania and Rodney Musch
results.brief_description: Set in the rugged Cradle Mountain region of Tasmania, this film points out the dangers of exposure for those who go into the mountains unprepared. An experienced group of walkers demonstrate, equipment, clothing, food, and techniques suitable for bushwalking.

results.title: A Matter of manners
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Colin Dean
results.brief_description: Made to improve the relations of the Commonwealth Public Service with the public, this film focuses attention on three important factors in giving service: the need for suitable office facilities in the form of counters, reception desks and entrances to government offices; The desirability of selecting counter staff and receptionists who have an aptitude for their work, expressed in the right approach to the public over the counter; the importance of systematic training for counter staff and receptionists in the fundamental and details of their jobs. Camera - Frank Bagnall. PLEASE NOTE: THIS FILM IS AVAILABLE FOR SCREENINGS TO COMMONWEALTH AND STATE GOVERNMENT DEPARTMENTS ONLY. THE PERMISSION OF THE COMMONWEALTH PUBLIC SERVICE BOARD IS NECESSARY FOR ALL OTHER SCREENINGS OF THIS TITLE.

results.title: A Matter of fat
results.creator_credit: Desmond Dew, ONF | NFB and William Weintraub
results.brief_description: A rather astonishing film showing how one man shed nearly half his body weight - 63 kg of it (140 pounds) - by complete starvation under hospital observation. What brought him to so desperate a course, and how he managed to cope with it, is told with candor and humor by the fat man himself. Lorne Greene narrates the rest. Between times, the film leaves Gilles Lorrain and his lonely struggle to examine what other overweight people are doing, singly or in groups, to reduce to more normal proportions. Medical authorities comment on some misconceptions and malpractices of the slimming industry. Narrated by Lorne Green. (Awards: Toronto; New York; Atlanta)

results.title: A Matter of conscience: Henry VIII and Sir Thomas More
results.creator_credit: Fred Zimmerman and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Western Civilization”.
An edited version of ‘A Man for All Seasons’ concentrating on the historic clash between Henry VIII and Sir Thomas More as a prototypical confrontation between the power of the state and the individual who chooses to oppose it.

results.title: A Matter of confidence: movement for children and parents (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Centre for Educational Services, Bristol Polytechnic
results.brief_description: Uses Veronica Sherbourne’s methods in a movement session for children and their parents. Shows how movement experiences presented in the form of play can develop confidence in young children. Demonstrates how relationships can develop between adult and child, and between child and child. Includes a sequence involving slow learning children. Devised and narrated by Veronica Sherbourne.
results.title_for_label: A Matter of confidence: movement for children and parents (TEFC)

results.title: A Matter of communication (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
FOCUS looks at the difficulties experienced by many migrants in understanding the Anglo-Saxon legal system and investigates the way people are treated at the hands of the law. A Vietnamese man in condemned for killing a dog for consumption and a Lebanese man allegedly is bashed by police.

results.title: A Matter of commonsense, mainly
results.creator_credit: L.J. Connolly, New Zealand National Film Unit and John Cooper
results.brief_description: Increasing numbers of people go boating and boating accidents are happening in increasing numbers. A variety of mariners, including some real old salts, tell of safety in different kinds of small craft, and relate anecdotes from their own experiences. Written and directed by John Cooper.

results.title: A Matter of choice
results.creator_credit: Valentine Stewart, Crawford Productions and Keith Hounslow
results.brief_description: The Colleges of Advanced Education both in the metropolitan area and the country offer alternative career training to the Universities as well as their role in technological training with which the public is already familiar. The colleges train students for careers in business and advertising, paramedical and other fields. From a treatment by Jim Harris.
